availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To all whom it may concern I certify that the name Jno W Shaver as found in a petition of the citizens of Gallatin County Ky. to his Excellency Gov. Thos E Bramlette for the pardon of Jno W. Shaver centenced to the confinement in the State Pentitentiary for a term of two years by the Gallatin Circuit Court March Term 1864. charged with the crime of manslaughter, is from my examination of the "Register of Prisoners in the Penitentiary of Ky." for the same person as the name "Jno N Shafer" as found in said Register of Prisoners and the certificate of E. Whitesides filed herewith

D. G. Venable
Frankfort Ky
May 20" 1864

Gallatin Cir Ct
vs
John N Shafer
Pardoned
18th May/64
